intro: Pyrrhotrichia, commonly known as the clubmoss, is a genus of vascular plants belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, scale-like leaves and a unique reproductive structure called a strobilus. Pyrrhotrichia species are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. They play an important role in soil stabilization and provide habitat for various microorganisms. Due to their ancient lineage, they are considered living fossils and offer insights into early plant evolution.
